Project nameCropAdvisor
Sep 2015

Project descriptionIn Sri Lanka, a considerable amount of information relevant to farmers involved in the export sector is held within government departments and Ministries. How can we create a solution that enables farmers to receive important information vital to their work and also allow them to share information about disease outbreaks and other issues?
CropAdvisor addresses the above problem. It is an Android app that has information related to crop advisory, the ability to take geo-tagged photographs and upload to a platform for identifying and tracking diseases, and a platform where farmers can advertise to exporters. This is a two way information channel for farmers. It enables farmers to receive the data stored in a central information database. Regarding field preparation, harvesting, packaging, water management, diseases, pesticides etc. Also they can ask their issues through the Android application and receive expert’s feedback.

See project CropAdvisorSee project

Project namemWiki - Offline wikipedia search
2014

Project descriptionOffline wikipedia search through SMS.

How it works.
* Register : Type REG<space>MWIKI and send to 77155
* Search : Type MWIKI<space><Search keyword> and send to 77155
* Results will receive as numbered SMSs. Only receive the first paragraph of relevent wikipedia page.

Limitations.
* LKR 2 will be charged per day.
* Unlimited number of searches without additional cost.
* Only for Dialog mobile connections.

projects.description:
WSO2 IoT Server
Apr 2015 – Dec 2017

Project descriptionWSO2 IoT Server is a complete solution that enables device manufacturers and enterprises to connect and manage their devices, build apps, manage events, secure devices and data, and visualize sensor data in a scalable manner.

It also offers a complete and secure enterprise mobility management (EMM/MDM) solution that aims to address mobile computing challenges faced by enterprises today. Supporting iOS, Android, and Windows devices, it helps organizations deal with both corporate owned, personally enabled (COPE) and employee-owned devices with the bring your own device (BYOD) concept.

WSO2 IoT Server comes with advanced analytics, enabling users to analyze speed, proximity and geo-fencing information of devices including details of those in motion and stationary state.

See project WSO2 IoT ServerSee project

Project namePublic Complaining System
Oct 2014 – Oct 2014

Project descriptionNBQSA 2014 Gold Awarded project (in Business Category-Tertiary)

The system contains a web service which can be accessed via a website, mobile app and SMS. Users can post their complaints regarding issues on services, service providers and infrastructure, while other users (including government sectors, private companies, volunteers etc.) can comment and vote on them. This can act as a medium to emphasis the "real" problems that already exists among us. This is really beneficial for:

general public : get their problems to responsible parties and get comments/suggestions from others
companies : obtain customer feedbacks and identify the issues to be addressed.
government authorities : identify the malfunctioning sectors.
news agencies : NEWS
volunteers : identify the real problems and help to obtain solutions.

Other creators
Praneeth Peiris Milindu Sanoj Kumarage Dhanushka Chandana 
Project nameSPAM-Bot
Oct 2014 – Oct 2014

Project descriptionThis is an Autonomous Robot designed to navigate across a map and collect payloads distributed at various points. These payloads are delivered at the other end of the map in a sorted order (adjacent to each other with only the last payload on top if the previous one). The sorting is done according to a barcode number printed on each face of the payload.

The project is build using the Arduino UNO and Arduino duemilanove/ATmega328p boards. It makes use of continuous rotational servos for the wheels of the robot and positional rotational motors for the robot arm and gripper. IR sensors are used to detect and follow the navigational path. A Sonar sensor is used to identify the payloads across the map. A Rasberry Pi connected to a normal Webcam is used to capture the payload key and process it.

Other creators
Shabir Mohamed Praneeth Peiris Madura Anushanga
See project SPAM-BotSee project

Project nameConstruction Project Management System
Jun 2012 – Jun 2012

Project descriptionIt provides the company an attractive web site which promotes their services and products to the customers. The site displays number of constructions the company has built. Since internet is a very popular media, it helps to promote the company more efficiently. 
The site would help to improve the standards of the company. When a client gets registered through the site they get a personal profile which they can use to communicate with the company. They get the opportunity to get information about their projects by login to their profiles and checking their current process, in addition each profile has a photo gallery which displays photos of their on going project sites. And also there is a BOQ service for users who request that service.
Employees of the company also can get registered through the site. So they can check their pay sheets themselves online by login to their profiles.
The site gives the opportunity to advertise for other firms/organizations. For that initially an external company can request for this opportunity by filing the form provided.
In conclusion this project has successfully fulfilled the above goals providing a fully functional user friendly web portal to the company Dasunie constructions.

projects.description:
IceFresh
Oct 2014 – Present

Project descriptionThis is the most compelling project that I have contributed in my career. It is a full supply change management system implemented for a fish selling company in Norway, supported with a E-commerce front end as well. Fish caught in Norway and Sri Lanka are exported to China and sold through online stores to a Chinese niche. This project includes a number of integrations with Chinese 3rd parties such as Alibaba, JingDong, Warehousing (PFS), and delivery services such as Yamato, SF. System contains a fully customized Dynamics CRM solution to support inventory management, shipment management, order management, customer handling and product catalog managemet, supported and strengthened by a stable NodeJS backend. NodeJS back end acts as a communication layer between 3rd parties and the CRM solution. Technologies and platforms cover Dynamics CRM, NodeJS, Angular JS, Mongo DB, Azure etc.

Other creator
Malinda Perera
Project nameAn Adaptive Gamified e-Learning System Based on Student Modeling
Dec 2012 – Present

Project descriptionIt is an adaptive e-Learning platform based on some modeling techniques. Gamification was utilized to enhance student motivation. 3D games are used as the main learning material. To plan the adaptation 2 main mathematical models were used. The first one is a knowledge model which measures the concept-wise knowledge of users based on a mathematical theory known as Dempster-Shafer Theory. The other one is a fuzzy logic based behavior tracking model which measures the level of interaction and performance of users within the 3D games (Learning Materials). The results of these models are used to deliver an adaptive, interactive and personalized learning experience to the learners. Algorithm construction was done using C# and the game construction was done with Unity 3D and C# scripting.

Project nameEnki
Jan 2012 – Present

Project descriptionIt is a knowledge sharing system specially designed for organizational context. When a question is asked by a particular user, that question is automatically directed to the best expert within the organization. The expert is recognized based on a multi-criterion process including expertise, geographic location, companionship etc. This was a service based application and I was responsible for tagging the question (extracting key words). The tagging algorithm was designed after a research carried on natural language processing.

Other creator
Nuwan Samarasekera
Project nameNordeca
May 2014 – Sep 2014

Project descriptionIt is a geo-information based mobile application for iphones. Target audience of the app was travel lovers/hikers and they have the ability to find, share, save locations, purchase maps for offline usage etc. For map generation, a 3rd part map service called Faster Imaging was used. I was involved in Objective C based app development, Java back end development and amazon cloud management tasks.

Janidu Wanigasuriya

Project nameBusiness Intelligence Framework to analyze data related to organizational middle ware
Jan 2011 – Dec 2011

Project descriptionIt was a challenge to implement a BI framework for analyzing data related to organizational middle ware, since those data were not easily analyzable (e.g: server data, error rate, response time etc). But we integrated a number of features that should be in a BI environment such as graphical representation of data (a dash board), standard and customized reports, statistical analysis and data mining. We used Apriori algorithm to find some relationships between those data.

Project nameA PC based system to monitor and control growth parameters of a plant
Jan 2010 – Dec 2010

Project descriptionIt was a combination of HW and SW which was basically intended to be kept in a green house. It measures environmental parameters like temperature, humidity and light intensity through low cost sensors and shows them to system users. And the system automatically takes corrective actions if the parameters deviate from a predefined range.

May 2012 – Present

Project descriptionThis is to automate the widget deployment in Wookie server, allowing the widgets' content to be signed. At deployment, the server needs to verify the widgets to be from a trusted source and not modified using the digital signature and certificates. This is to be implemented inside Wookie under specifications of W3C.

Project nameBig Data CDR Analyzer- Kanthaka
Feb 2012 – Present

Project description ‘Kanthaka’, is to develop a high volume Caller Detail Record (CDR) analyzer. This is to analyze the huge volume of data generated at telecom operator’s end and to select the eligible entries, according to the predefined rules, in near real time. It involves thorough research on big data technologies and implementations of fine tuned algorithms for the use case.
Technologies: [Map-reduce (Hadoop), NoSQL(Cassandra), Rules engines(Drools), NewSQL(VoltDB)]

Clients – Salmat pty ltd

Product Name:  ISO - Transbridge
Transbridge is designed to plug any ATM network and core banking backend. Financial institutes need a bridge to connect back end with third party ATMs.  ATMs communicate with their backend via ISO 8583 messages. 
ISO Transabridge is designed to break and construct ISO 8583 messages. It is a matter of time to implement interfaces to break vendor specific ISO formats and backend transaction handling. We have followed Factory and Proxy design patterns to overcome the issue of connecting ATM networks and back end. 
The product is released with a monitoring tool and ISO message generator.  Monitoring tool is used to monitor sever status and transaction history. ISO message generator is designed to act as ATM for testing connectivity and transactions.
Software/ Technology Used:
•	Java 1.7 , Spring core/Dao
•	Sl4j / logback - logging
•	JUnit - unit testing
•	Maven 3 project management 
•	Sonar - code quality
Clients – LOLC, CLC, MelstartRegal

Responsibilities (ISO – Transbridge, FIX –Transbridge, Banking Solution – USSD intergration): 
•	Design the most appropriate architecture for the solution.
•	Technology finding for implementation: Research & Development, Proof of  concept to select the most appropriate technology
•	Implement the base framework of the product. 
•	The responsibilities for planning and managing the work are split between members of team and review their day to day development.
•	Derive and deliver Technical Solution and take a leadership role in doing so and R&D.
•	Troubleshoot problems and implement appropriate solutions to problems
•	Participate in periodic review meetings with the Senior Software Architect to discuss project status, system design and product requirements
•	Overall Technical responsibility of the projects assigned

general.headline: Associate Technical Lead at WSO2 working for Stream Processor and Analytics team
general.description:
I am a software engineer at WSO2 and part of the team en route to make the best middleware platform of the world. It is always interesting to invent technology, solutions which will be used globally. I am mainly passionate about Big Data and real-time event processing. Analyzing data, converting to information and visualizing them is always a fascinating process.

Specialties: CEP, Big Data, Java

jobs.description:
Working as a member of WSO2 Complex Event Processor project which focuses on
      real-time event processing. Work includes technologies like WSO2 Siddhi, Apache
      
      Storm and LMAX Disruptor.

Currently I am following Bsc. Engineering degree program at University of Moratuwa.
      
      My field of specialization is Computer Science and Engineering

Currently I am contributing to Apache Software Foundation under Apache ManifoldCF
      
      project.

Projects:
Big data analytics and visualization using different frameworks
A project to analyze page view details of a website using Apache Hive, which
comes in a csv file and visualize results using different reporting frameworks such
as Pentaho, Jasper and GoodData.

WSO2 Enterprise Service Bus(ESB) integration tests
A project to develop integration test cases for WSO2 ESB. Test Scenarios were
given and we were supposed to develop test cases to ensure functionality.

WSO2 Complex Event Processing(CEP) performance improvement and
documentation
Under the performance improvement project modifications were done to WSO2
Databridge component to minimize event conversions and thus increase
performance.
Under documentation project code samples and documentation were developed for
WSO2 CEP new product release.

Technologies : Java, XML, Apache Hadoop, Apache Hive, Apache Synapse, Apache
Thrift, Apache Axis2, TestNG, JUnit, OSGi, SVN, Maven

I contributed to Eclipse Foundation as a part of GSoC 2012 and still contributing as a
      
      community contributor.

projects.description:
Sinhalapedia
    Starting January 2011

    Team members:
            Tishan Dahanayakage,
            Nirman Kodithuwakku,
            Chamith Nilanka Wijesinghe

    Wihidum : Distributed CEP
    February 2013 – February 2013

    In the present world, complex event processing (CEP) is becoming increasingly popular in present highly competitive enterprise culture. Its ability to analyze series of events in real time and deduce results based on those events is highly sought after. Today even a handset can be used as a sensor device to generate events for analyzing. The growth of sensor devices has evoked the possibility of event streams that surpass processing capabilities of present CEP products. Hence, new techniques are needed to overcome these issues.

    One suitable solution to overcome the above mentioned challenge is to implement a distributed CEP solution. Distributed solution consists of multiple CEP nodes that run as a single system but are distributed among multiple physically separated machines connected by a network.
    Although we deploy a distributed system, we cannot achieve theoretical maximum performance due to performance losses arise from several reasons. Main challenges of this project is trying to minimize these losses in order to increase the performance gain.
    WSO2 CEP will be used as CEP nodes for this project.

    Team members:
            Tishan Dahanayakage,
            Sameera Kannangara,
            Sachini Jayasekara

    Protocol Independent Connectivity interface for Eclipse ECF Salvo Newsreader
    August 2012 – August 2012

    A project to write protocol independent connectivity interface for Salvo
    newsreader. Existing implementation was tightly coupled with NNTP protocol.
    Architectural restructuring was needed to implement a protocol independent
    connectivity interface.

    Team members:
            Tishan Dahanayakage

    Test automation for WSO2 ESB
    July 2012 – August 2012

    This was a hackathon carried out to automate the integration tests of WSO2 ESB and expand its test coverage.

    Team members:
            Tishan Dahanayakage,
            Hasintha Indrajee,
            Harsha Kumara,
            Andun S.L. Gunawardana,
            Prabhath Pathirana,
            Denuwanthi De Silva,
            Dharshana Kasun Warusavitharana,
            Hareesan Rajendra,
            Chaamini Mangaleswaran,
            Thilini Shanika

    Implement an email repository connector for Apache ManifoldCF
    May 2012 – May 2012

    Apache ManifoldCF is an effort to provide an open source framework for
    connecting source content repositories to target repositories or indexes. Goal of
    the project is to implement an email repository connector, which have the ability
    to connect to an email server and crawl the content.

    Team members:
            Tishan Dahanayakage

    Tanks - Game Client
    May 2011 – December 2011

    “Tanks” is an arcade game. Opponents are computer players controlled by AI. Due to the research done to support this particular project, my knowledge of fuzzy logic, collaborative diffusion was widened.

    Team members:
            Tishan Dahanayakage,
            Thushan Ganegedara

    Cyber Security Drill 2011
    March 2011 – November 2011

    A cyber security drill is a simulation of a cyberspace attack on the infrastructure of the banking sector. It is intended towards evaluating the readiness of banks in handling a cyber attack. The primary objective of a Cyber-security drill is to create awareness among the bank personnel regarding the possibility of cyber-attacks and the severity of the outcomes of such attacks.

    Team members:
            Tishan Dahanayakage,
            Malinga Perera,
            Asitha Nanayakkara,
            Rashmika Nawaratne,
            Pasindu Perera,
            Gayashan Amarasinghe

allSkills: Software Engineering, Java, Eclipse, Algorithms, OOP, Programming, Big Data, C, XML, NetBeans, Android, Apache, Matlab, MySQL, C#, CEP, ManifoldCF

projects.description:
V+
May 2014 – May 2014

Project descriptionBusiness Situation
With over 86% of employees being ‘Millennials’, Virtusa wanted to transform the way its employees worked, learned, shared and connected to accelerate innovation, increase collaboration and transparency and to drive productivity across the company.

Solution
Virtusa chose Microsoft SharePoint to build a platform that brought together the systems of records and systems of engagement to transform and integrate social practices into its core processes of software development, people management and sales
